name: InterContinental London Park Lane

reviews.text: When in London, my goal is to live in the city and not in my hotel room, so my target is to combine location and a decent dose of luxury with excellent value, and in that regard, the Intercontinental excels.
reviews.title: Perfect Quotient: Value...Service...Luxury

reviews.text: Fresh off an attractive freshening, the reception area and staff provided a warm welcome on an early morning arrival when I stepped off the Piccadilly Line from LHR at the hotel doorstep. Early check-in was expedited and my request for a top floor room in a quiet area was honored, even though I'm not an IHG elite and was staying on AA miles.
reviews.title: Only positive things to say about this hotel

reviews.text: The standard room was quite adequate, the bed extremely comfortable, the bath well appointed and spotless, and the Elemis toiletries of wonderful quality. More importantly, the hotel was quiet and great sleeps provided every night.
reviews.title: LUXURY UNSURPASSED

reviews.text: My rate included breakfast, and I found the variety and quality to be excellent and the service was very attentive and warm....so much so that I really didn't need anything substantive again until dinner.
reviews.title: Classic, standard five star hotel

reviews.text: If your objective is all-out luxury there are options that would fit the bill more precisely, but if you are seeking a balance of luxury and value in a central and convenient location, I suggest the Intercontinental to you with confidence.
reviews.title: Still as Wonderful as the First Time

reviews.text: Stayed here 24 to 26 December. Excellent hotel spoiled only by the number of young children running riot around the corridors and club lounge - I blame the nannies / parents, tho the staff could do more to keep them in order perhaps. That being said, it's a great hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: Excellent - shame about the feral children everywhere

reviews.text: Book in advance and you can get a decent price for this hotel. I have always booked the cheapest room and they've always upgraded me. Never used the Club Room as it seems like a very expensive way to buy breakfast.
reviews.title: My favourite London hotel by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very large for London, clean and comfortable. I did a lot of work in the room itself and didn't have any issues. Bathroom is nice, which is something I am always very picky about. Bathtub fills very quickly though which is a common problem in London hotels.
reviews.title: Celebrating a Two Birthdays and an Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ultra-fast check-in and check-out. Room service was efficient. Housekeeping was absolutely fine. Fast internet. Nice to see the wifi internet is reasonably fast - something a lot of London hotels, even business hotels, fail to deliver.
reviews.title: Fancy hotel in convenient location

reviews.text: Couldn't really fault anything except the food was very average for the expensive price. Otherwise it was entirely what I was expecting from an Intercontinental. Location is not ideal if you are a tourist as Piccadilly, Marble Arch and Oxford Circus are quite a long walk away. Nearest tube stations are Green Park and Hyde Park Corner.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Spent two nights in March there, beautiful hotel, great staff, gorgeous room, expensive champagne, but a brilliant stay thanks
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, super service, great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a one night stay at this well located hotel, just a couple of mins walk to Hyde Park Corner tube station. We were upgraded to a room on the 8th floor with a huge balcony which afforded us wonderful panoramic views over London; superb!! The room was lovely with a rain shower, flat screen TV, large mini bar and giant comfortable bed with large cozy pillows - I only wish we had had longer to spend enjoying the room and exploring the hotel amenities
reviews.title: Panoramic views of London included! Wonderful comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: not much to say, great service and location, would go back. rooms really nice. staff couldn't have been more helpful. Only issue is extortionately expensive wifi, ICHG really need to sort this out.
reviews.title: Great london hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through a bid at Priceline for $160 per night, which is how I was able to afford it. When I received the information on the hotel, the first thing I did was look it up on Trip Advisor and I was thrilled. The hotel is in a fantastic neighborhood perched between the corners of Hyde Park and Green Park. The Hyde Park tube station is a two minute walk and the Green Park tube station a five minute walk, which gives you a lot of flexibility getting around London. A scenic stroll through Green Park has you arriving on the doorstep of Buckingham Palace.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you walk into the hotel you are greeted by a smiling doorman, white marble floors and crystal chandeliers. There are stunning arrangements of lillies throughout the first level.
reviews.title: Perfect overnighter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are comfortable, modern/traditional and are well kept. Reception is very nice and modern along with the bar and afternoon tea room. Our only piece of feedback is about the refurbishments happening on the 6th floor. We were on the 5th floor and we could hear, drilling, banging and moving furniture from early morning. We did call down and they stopped for an hour. However, it did start again until we checked out at 12. We informed the gentlemen at reception who apologized, but clearly heard this complaint every day. We also informed the manager not to put guests in our room, as we were not impressed. But, I'm sure that they will. If you stay, steer clear of the 5th floor. It's not a pleasant experience. Once the refurbishments have finished, it'll be a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel. But....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night - room only - using Priority Club points. The hotel is very nice and in a fantastic location on Park Lane between Hyde Park and Green Park (both have tube stations within an easy walk of the hotel).
reviews.title: Luxury on Park Lane

reviews.text: The lobby is contemporary and luxurious. Front desk staff are immaculately turned out and extremely professional - only the beautiful people seem to work here! However I did feel that I was being checked in by a Revenue Manager rather than a Receptionist as the emphasis was very much on upselling.
reviews.title: Hip Hotel In The Centre Of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast? No thanks. Dinner? No thanks. Club Lounge access? (£108). No thanks. Just when I thought we'd finished she noticed my Ambassador membership had expired and asked if I'd like to renew for $150. No thanks!
reviews.title: FABULOUS

reviews.text: I was then handed my room key and bid a polite farewell. Despite being a Priority Club member no room upgrade was offered. I did feel that if I'd answered "Yes" to any of the above then I'd probably have been upgraded. A little disappointing as I've already demonstrated my loyalty to IHG Hotels by being a Platinum member.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at this hotel you are greeted by helpful staff and friendly receptionists where nothing is too much trouble ! Reception is opulent and the floral dispalys are superb. Our room, 467 was spacious and clean. Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel in Mayfair. The bed, well let me tell you it is the most comfortable bed I have ever experienced in a hotel in the world, even to the point that I contacted the German based company who supplies the pillows and am having 4 of them shipped over!
reviews.title: BEST NIGHTS SLEEP I'VE EVER HAD !

reviews.text: Superb experience, excellent breckfast facilities and service that has exceeded all other stays in London at any other hotel. Well Done and keep doing what you are doing !
reviews.title: A nice stay..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located on the edge of Mayfair and within walking distance of Knightsbridge shopping & dinning. The rooms are well furnished and fairly sized for London hotels. The staff is very friendly and pro-active in their thinking of guest needs.
reviews.title: Could have been a disaster, transformed into success !!!

reviews.text: Was on a leisure weekend with my wife, booked on hotwire.
reviews.title: Good, but could do a lot better

reviews.text: Standard room (very nice, very comfortable bed).
reviews.title: Great for Business in West End area and local site seeing

reviews.text: It’s a nice and Very clean hotel, although the double room beds are very small compared to American double room beds, , the beds are half the size of a Queen bed, so you can only sleep 1 in each bed.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel, Nice Staff, Super Safe West End Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is Very very nice and Very Very Clean, in fact the Hotel is Super Clean in all areas even the Lobby, halls they all look like they are brand new
reviews.title: Brilliant Location, Superb Staff, Generally a Great, memorable stay.

reviews.text: The Staff is very Nice and super professional, I usually empty the mini bar and put my own stuff in there, and then put their stuff back when I check out, and at some hotels that’s a problem, but not here, I wrote a note that they should not refill the mini bar, and they didn’t 
reviews.title: Wonderful staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They got about 50% smoking rooms in the hotel so make sure to book a non smoking, even if you are a smoker, the non smoker rooms are always nicer and cleaner.
reviews.title: One of London's best!
Not many better than this
reviews.text: The location is either ok or excellent, the Tube(Subway) is right outside the door and it’s a 5minute ride to Piccadilly Square, and a 45minute ride to Heathrow airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Intercontinental and booked through Priceline. For the price it was a nice deal although I suspect this hotel uses Priceline to fill smaller rooms. Our room was probably 2/3 the size of the rooms adjacent to ours. Aside from the size though, the bed was very comfy and the room was well appointed. From the hotel, we walked nearly everywhere we wanted to go in Central London. I would certainly stay again but I wouldn't pay regular Intercontinental prices.
reviews.title: Great location, comfy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the intercontinental via expedia secret hotels. I paid £125 per night and paid £30 per night for an upgrade to a superior room. The room was a good size with all the facilities you could need or want. The staff were all extremely helpful. I cannot fault this hotel. The only thing I would say is that food and drinks are expensive but you do expect that in a 5* hotel.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in good location

reviews.text: They should offer free wifi like most hotels do now.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Perfect Service

reviews.text: We returned to this hotel having visited a couple of years ago. We arrived just after lunch and decided that as our suite was not quite ready we would go and do a bit of shopping etc. The reception service was excellent and when we returned our room was ready and our suitcases were already in our suite.
reviews.title: Exceptional decor and lovely furnishings

reviews.text: Our suite was beautifully decorated with excellent amenties, however upon entering our suite there was a very bad smell of smoke. We immediately discussed this with the lady in the Club Lounge and she appologised and said that there were no further rooms available, but would arrange for housekeeping to freshen up our suite whilst we are eating out that evening. This was acceptable to us, but we were disappointed that we had been put in a smoking room in the first place !!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but very expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Intercon Park Lane on several occasions. The staff is always friendly and professional and go out of their way to provide exceptional service at all times without a snobby attitude. The hotel itself is stylish, clean and quiet. I always sleep well here. The club lounge is an added benefit. I've eaten in both restaurants, the club lounge and had room service and have never been disappointed. All of the staff members go out of their way to help find whatever you are looking for. We went for a late night walk one evening and they even provided a winter coat for one male member of our party who only had a suit jacket. The location is excellent for tourists. 5 minutes across the park to Buckingham Palace, 5 minutes down the street from the Ritz and probably 15 minutes to Kensington Palace. Nobu is right around the corner. Highly recommend The Woseley for afternoon tea or lunch. You never know who you will see in there. Also recommend La Boudin Blanc for lunch or dinner as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: This is a super spot in Mayfair.I had a room over looking Hamilton Place and Hyde Park.
reviews.title: Classy hotel make sure you have a big wallet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its very modern with black and white the theme. Lovely marble everywhere.
reviews.title: A pleasant Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bose sound system in the room.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: My rate didn't include breakfast which was £28 in the cafe restaurant a bit pricey.
reviews.title: Great Week End

description: Once the site of a royal residence, InterContinental London Park Lane is now the epitome of modern elegance. Located between Mayfair and Knightsbridge in view of Buckingham Palace, the hotel is not far from the Tower of London, Big Ben and Trafalgar Square. Also worth seeing is the Victoria and Albert Museum, Madame Tussauds and The National Portrait Gallery.
